> <OLD>
>
> Wheelie glanced up at the sky, "The more things change, the more they stay
> the same.  Look at us, here on the range.  Look at what we were, in the
> heavens where we occur.  The AUtobots, the Decepticons. Now the Maximals and
> the Predacons.  What we were, now are they.  The war carried on aother way.
> In the ages to come, in the ages to pass, will someday they be the ancients
> watching as their descendents carry the ballast?"
>
> Looking up to the heavens, "Is that what we are?  Always at war?  Can we
> bedevil no other fates but what shall occur?"  Pausing, "The roads, the
> skylanes, all to war.  In the past, in hte future.  Can we never ever find a
> way to suture?  I see what we were, I see what we are.  I see nothing but
> destruction from star to star.  It makes me sad, it makes me mope, for being
> here I see we have no hope.  For even if we do win..  We shall begin the
> cycle yet again.  Even if we protect the past, the future shall have war, it
> will always last."

<NEW>

There was a nod from LORD ELDER, "So you are becoming much like any of
us now." He patted WHEELIE on the shoulder in a hopefully comforting
gesture, "You are growing tired of the war."

He smiled in a companiable way, "That is good. There are others who
seem to live for battle, even when they say they are looking for
peace." A sorrowful looked passed over ELDER's face, "Keep this
feeling, treasure it. Try to use it to keep you going, so that as you
fight this war you do not loose focus of your goal - peace."

(TAG)

Preston
